cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: expected to bend northwest later Friday, turn north on Saturday, then track northward through Arkansas into Missouri/Illinois early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm watches extend from the mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA and eastward to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm Surge warnings from Intracoastal City, LA to Grand Isle, LA and east to Biloxi, MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast (Upper TX coast eastward through Louisiana and coastal Mississippi)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No Missouri location listed – closest table point is SHREVEPORT LA
weather_observation.wind: Sub-tropical-storm strength; occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as remnants pass
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – port is far inland on the Missouri River
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain possible Tuesday, brief local ponding; main flood concern on smaller tributaries
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential for elevated river levels on the Missouri River and temporary current increase that could hamper barge movements
